name: Virtual Cooking Recipe: Chicken Tacos/ Tacos de Pollo
preparationTips:
Time to make thirty minutes Serves:4
Ingredients 
 1/2 cup of cheese of choice
1 cup fresh veggies
1 cup whole grains
1 cup chicken
4 hardshell or soft shell tacos

Step By Step 

Cook chicken and shred it, season to  taste. 
Chop up and grill fresh veggies of your family's choice.
Add grains of your choice 
Mix all together and serve on a warmed hardshell or softshell tortilla.

name: Virtual Cooking Recipe:Stuffed Spaghetti shells
preparationTips:
Time to make 35 minutes Serves:4 
Ingredients 
 1 cup of philadelphia cream cheese or cream cheese of choice
1 cup of grated cheese of choice
1 lb of ground protein of choice
 1 lb of JUMBO pasta shells
 1 jar of your favorite pasta sauce

 Step By Step 

Cook protein fully in a pan. 
Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Boil pasta shells for 7 minutes or al dente.
 Mix protein and cream cheese together 
 Stuff pasta shells with tablespoon of mixture 
 Add to large oven friendly container and sprinkle grated cheese on top 
Wait 7 minutes then enjoy after cooling!

name: Virtual Cooking Recipe: Tomato Soup Night
preparationTips:
Time to make 35 minutes Serves:4 
Ingredients 
2 tablespoons unsalted butter
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
1 medium onion, very thinly sliced
3 garlic cloves, smashed 
 5 cups canned whole tomatoes in their juice (from three 14-ounce cans)
 1 cup water
 2/3 cup heavy cream
1 tablespoon sugar
 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper 
1/4 teaspoon celery seed
 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano 
 4  3/4-inch-thick slices of white country bread, crusts trimmed, bread cut into 3/4-inch dice

 Step by Step 
 In a large saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the sliced onion and smashed garlic and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
 Add the tomatoes and their juice, the water, heavy cream, sugar, crushed red pepper, celery seed and oregano and season with salt and pepper.
Bring the soup to a boil over high heat, breaking up the tomatoes with the back of a spoon. Reduce the heat to moderate and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small skillet, cook the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter over moderately high heat until it begins to brown, about 1 minute. Scrape the browned butter into a medium bowl.
Add the olive oil to the skillet. Add the diced bread and cook over medium- high heat, stirring, until it is slightly browned, about 6 minutes. Transfer the bread to the browned butter and toss well.
 Working in batches, transfer the tomato soup to a blender and puree until smooth.
 Return the soup to a clean pot and rewarm the soup if necessary.
 Season the soup with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve with the croutons.

name: Virtual Cooking Recipe: Spinach Artichoke Chicken
preparationTips:
Time to make 30 minutes Serves:4 
Ingredients
 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
 4 to 6 boneless skinless chicken breasts
 Salt and pepper to taste
 1box (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed to drain
 1jar (14 oz) marinated artichoke hearts, chopped
 2 jars (14 oz each) roasted garlic Alfredo pasta sauce
 ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, OPTIONAL.

 Step by Step
 Heat 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, swirling to coat. Sprinkle 4 to 6 boneless skinless chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Cook in oil 10 to 12 minutes, turning once. Remove from skillet; cover with foil to keep warm.
 In same skillet, add 1 box (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed to drain, and 1 jar (14 oz) marinated artichoke hearts, chopped. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through.
Add 2 jars (14 oz each) roasted garlic Alfredo pasta sauce. Simmer 4 minutes. Add chicken back to skillet. Cook about 2 minutes or until heated. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, if desired.

name: Virtual Cooking Recipe: Baked Mac and Cheese
preparationTips:
Time to make 30 minutes Serves:4 
Ingredients
 2 cups of each *Cheeses of Choice* - try 3/Shred them yourself
 2 cups of room temperature milk 
 1 pound of pasta
 ¼ cup butter or fat of choice. 
 Step by Step
 Boil the pasta, drain.
 Make the cheese sauce by combining a fat (butter), and starch (flour), then whisking in the milk products.
 Cook the sauce until it’s nice and thick.
 Add in shredded cheeses, stir well.
 Combine cheese sauce with cooked pasta.
 Transfer half of the mac and cheese to a baking dish, sprinkle with more shredded cheese.
 Top with the rest of the mac and cheese, top with more shredded cheese.
 Bake and prepare to thoroughly enjoy!

name: Virtual Cooking Recipe:Shredded Brussel Sprouts
preparationTips:
Time to make 25 minutes Serves:4 
Ingredients
 10.5 oz Brussels sprouts
 Olive Oil
 1 lemon -juice
 2 tbsp pine nuts
 ½ cup of seasoned breadcrumbs
 3 tbsp parmesan (vegan)
 Salt&pepper to taste
 Step by Step
 Slice the end off the sprouts and chop them in half. Place them flat side down and finely chop until they are all shredded.
 Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large frying pan or work to medium heat, add the sprouts, lemon zest, seasoning and cook for 5 minutes. 
 Add the wine and cook for a further 5 minutes 
  Add  1 tablespoon of olive oil and the lemon juice and cook for another 5-10 minutes.
 Pour the sprout mixture into a serving dish. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and stir through the breadcrumbs, pine nuts and vegan Parmesan.
 Season with salt and pepper.

name: Dallas Aquarium
preparationTips:
What rental items are available? A: No rental items available at this location. It is indoor so some earplugs may be recommended for folks with auditory sensitivies. 
 How much for parking?
 A: Price for parking varies from $8.00-$10.00
 Do they give Military Disccounts?
A: Yes Military Admission on active duty and retired military personnel, plus one guest, can each purchase admission for $22.95 + tax (photo ID required) 
 Costs:
 Admission:
 Adult: $28.95 + tax 
 Child: $18.95 + tax (3 thru 12)  
 Child: free (2 and under) 
 Senior :$22.95 +tax min age: 65+

name: Dallas Zoo
preparationTips:
How do I get to the Zoo?
 A:Located at 650 South R.L. Thornton Freeway in Dallas
 Via car:Exit at Marsalis Avenue from Interstate 35E. Our main entrance is located by the tall giraffe statue, on the northbound access road of I-35E.
 May I bring service animals into the Zoo?
A: Yes, ADA compliant service animals are permitted./n Where can I find family restrooms?
 A: Family restrooms can be found in ZooNorth in the Wonders of the Wild Amphitheater. An additional family restroom is available in Simmons Safari Base Camp in the Giants of the Savanna.
 What rental items are available?
 A: You may bring your own strollers and wheelchairs, but they also are available to rent on a first come, first served basis at the Gift Shop.
 Costs 
 Single stroller: $10 
Double stroller: $14 
 Manual wheelchair: $15 
  Electric convenience vehicle with canopy: $35
For More Information Call 469.554.7462
